prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: A freelance photojournalist who I've met in the past. Known for her ability to sniff out scoops and snap them with her trusty camera.
Character 2
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 3
Name: Di-Jun Wang
Description: President of Zheng Fa, and the victim in this case. His body was found on a film set.
Character 4
Name: Crew Member
Description: A props person at Global Studios, and the first to discover the body. Her name is Penny Nichols.
Character 5
Name: Shaun Fenn
Description: The child star of the monster movie being filmed. Mature for his age with a menacing demeanor.
Character 6
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A judge, and a member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence. Suspected of being involved in the president's murder.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 8
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: Senior partner at Edgeworth and Co. Acting as Fifi Laguarde's attorney in place of Rosie Ringer.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. She is a highly talented prosecutor, and is currently working with Interpol.
Character 10
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who thinks he's a real winner. Ran off in shock after discovering that his father is a criminal.
Character 11
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: A former prison warden. She is currently on trial for the murder of Bronco Knight.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Character 13
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: An animal-tamer-in-training at the Berry Big Circus. He came to watch the trial.
Character 14
Name: Will Powers
Description: An action star with Global Studios. He's playing the part of Taurusaurus in the movie that's currently being shot.
Character 15
Name: Tabby Lloyd
Description: A journalist who's always on the lookout for a scoop. Protégé of Lotta Hart.
Character 16
Name: Excelsius Winner
Description: Chairman of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence and the ringleader behind the underground auction. He is currently under arrest for murder.
Character 17
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: One of President Wang's bodyguards. Murdered while being held at the detention center.
Character 18
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin who escaped from prison three nights ago. His whereabouts are currently unknown.
Character 19
Name: Shelly de Killer
Description: A professional killer who made an attempt on President Wang's life at Gourd Lake.
Character 20
Name: Alf Aldown
Description: A freelance journalist who was murdered in the incident from 12 years ago.
Character 21
Name: Rosie Ringer
Description: A member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence. She was killed while attempting to avenge Alf Aldown.
Character 22
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A high school student looking to become a forensic investigator, and the younger sister of my former boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Yatagarasu Pin
Description: The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears. The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears. There was a bug hidden inside.
Evidence 1
Name: Forged Letter
Description: A letter written by an unknown person claiming to be Kay. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 2
Name: Bigg Building
Description: Site of the underground auctions. There is an entrance to the hidden fifty-first floor on the roof.
Evidence 3
Name: Creature Feature Flyer
Description: Latest in the series after a twelve-year hiatus: "Taurusaurus Vs. Gourdy".
Evidence 4
Name: Movie Set Locks
Description: The combination lock on the front gate was left untouched, while the side gate's chain was cut sometime last night.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes → President Wang's Autopsy Report
Description: Surrounded by shards of concrete. Flecks of something yellow stuck to clothes. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Monster Footprints
Description: The concrete was broken and the earth exposed. But are they really footprints? The concrete was broken and the earth exposed. Did Excelsius Winner dig up the ransom money? The concrete was broken and the earth exposed after Excelsius Winner dug up President Wang's corpse.
Evidence 7
Name: Taurusaurus Head
Description: Modeled on the first generation Taurusaurus design. Seems like it fell from the roof of the on-set production trailer last night.
Evidence 8
Name: Taurusaurus Plushie
Description: Belonged to President Wang. It can record and play back sound.
Evidence 9
Name: Behind-the-Scenes Photo
Description: Photo taken yesterday. No monster footprints and no body were visible at that point.
Evidence 10
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle in front of the elevator on the roof of the Bigg Building. Shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle arriving on the roof of the Bigg Building. There's no footage of the president riding the elevator down to leave.
Evidence 11
Name: Ms. Hart's Statement
Description: Ms. Hart was in the 51st-floor storeroom the night before last, but didn't see the president pass through.
Evidence 12
Name: Shaun's Rehearsal Tape
Description: Filmed yesterday evening. Shows Shaun rehearsing by a monster footprint.
Evidence 13
Name: Blue Truck
Description: Parked in front of the Bigg Building. Driver is nowhere to be found.
Evidence 14
Name: Mechanic's Gloves
Description: Meant for motorcycle maintenance, but currently covered in dirt for some reason. Excelsius Winner wore these when digging the monster footprints.
Evidence 15
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Details of a murder case from eighteen years ago. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Report on Knight
Description: A report from Warden Laguarde to Chairman Winner about the connection between Knight and Kanis.
Evidence 17
Name: Knight's Possessions
Description: A pocket chess set and a ring. Found in the safe in the auction storeroom. A pocket chess set and a ring Knight made from his father's signature stamp.
Evidence 18
Name: Bug
Description: The person in the red raincoat planted this inside Kay's Yatagarasu pin.
Evidence 19
Name: Ms. Lloyd's Tape
Description: A recording of signals that were intercepted from the bug that was planted in Kay's pin.
Evidence 20
Name: Bouquet
Description: A bouquet of lion lilies given to President Wang by Judge Gavèlle. Recovered from on top of his body by Shaun.
Evidence 21
Name: Sedative
Description: Used on both Kay and Shaun during their kidnapping. Brand name is "3 Zs".
Evidence 22
Name: SS-5 Incident Case File
Description: 12-year-old incident in which President Wang was kidnapped and the sole witness was murdered. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 23
Name: Fire
Description: One of the children set the orphanage yard on fire as a prank sometime during the evening before the incident.
Evidence 24
Name: Mr. Aldown's Autopsy Report
Description: Victim was struck on the head and died at around 1 AM on February 10th.
Evidence 25
Name: Mr. Aldown's Final Call
Description: Message left on Rosie Ringer's phone detailing what Aldown saw.
Evidence 26
Name: Bloody Button
Description: Found clutched in Aldown's right hand. The blood is his.
Evidence 27
Name: Mr. Aldown's Photograph
Description: Shows the president being kidnapped. Only one picture was taken. Touch the Check Button for details. Staged photograph taken after Aldown was killed. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 28
Name: Victim's Shoes
Description: Not actually Aldown's shoes. They appear to have been placed on his feet by the culprit after the murder took place.
Evidence 29
Name: Mysterious Blood Stain
Description: Left on the scene of the murder 12 years ago. The blood wasn't Aldown's.
Evidence 30
Name: Child's Drawing
Description: A picture drawn by the child who caused the fire during the incident 12 years ago. It depicts what he saw the night of the incident.
Evidence 31
Name: Correspondence Chess Diagram
Description: Sent to Bronco Knight by Bodhidharma Kanis. Printed rather than hand-written. Letter from Kanis retyped by the mastermind, and then sent on to Bronco Knight.
Evidence 32
Name: Lion Hot Air Balloon
Description: Smaller balloon used for promotional purposes. Saint is in charge of it and drives it around on the back of a truck.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Listen up. That woman met with the president on top of the Bigg Building.
Person: Lang
Testimony 1
Testimony: Two nights ago, she pushed the president off the roof, and he fell onto this film lot.
Person: Lang
Testimony 2
Testimony: At the time, there was no one else on the rooftop, aside from those two.
Person: Lang
Testimony 3
Testimony: There's no room for doubt! That woman murdered the president!
Person: Lang

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of Lang's testimonies. The user provided four testimonies from Lang. Let me go through each one and check against the evidence list.

Testimony 0: Lang says that "that woman" met with the president on the Bigg Building roof. The evidence includes Security Camera Footage (Evidence 10) which shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle on the roof. So maybe that supports Testimony 0. Not sure yet.

Testimony 1: Lang claims that two nights ago, she pushed the president off the roof onto the film lot. But looking at the evidence, the Security Camera Footage (10) shows them arriving on the roof, but no footage of the president leaving via the elevator. Also, Ms. Hart's Statement (11) says she was in the 51st-floor storeroom the night before last and didn't see the president pass through. Wait, the Bigg Building's 51st floor is the hidden one, so if the president was pushed off the roof, maybe he fell onto the film set. But the movie set's locks (Evidence 4) mention the side gate's chain was cut. The autopsy report (5) mentions concrete shards and yellow flecks. The Taurusaurus Head (7) fell from the roof of the production trailer. Maybe the president's body was placed there after the gate was cut, but the timing?

Testimony 2: Lang states there was no one else on the rooftop aside from the two (presumably Wang and Gavèlle). But if the Security Camera Footage (10) only shows them arriving, maybe someone else came later? But the testimony says at the time, there was no one else. The evidence about the Blue Truck (13) parked outside, driver missing. Not directly related. The Bug (18) planted in Kay's pin might indicate someone else was involved, but not sure.

Testimony 3: Lang concludes that woman murdered the president. If there's evidence that the president's body was moved or that the murder happened elsewhere, that could contradict this. For example, the Monster Footprints (6) were created when Excelsius Winner dug up the body, which implies the body was buried and then moved. The Crime Scene Notes (5) mention yellow flecks, which could be from the Taurusaurus costume. If the president was killed on the film set rather than pushed off the roof, that contradicts Lang's testimony. The Behind-the-Scenes Photo (9) taken yesterday shows no footprints or body, but the rehearsal tape (12) shows Shaun by a footprint. So maybe the body was placed after the photo was taken. If the president was pushed off the roof two nights ago (per Testimony 1), but the photo was taken yesterday (the day before the murder?), the timeline might conflict. Wait, the Bigg Building's roof meeting was two nights ago, but the body was found on the film set. The autopsy report's details might show he wasn't killed by the fall. Alternatively, the Forged Letter (1) could be a red herring. 

Looking at Evidence 10: Security camera shows Wang and Gavèlle arriving on the roof, but no footage of him leaving. So if he was pushed off, then he couldn't have left via the elevator. But if he was pushed off, the body would be at the film set. The Movie Set Locks (4) side gate was cut. So someone could have moved the body through the side gate. But if the president was killed two nights ago, but the set's photo (Evidence 9) from yesterday shows no body, then the body was placed there later. So the actual murder might not have been when he was pushed, but later. So if he was pushed but survived, then killed on the set, that contradicts Lang's testimony that she pushed him off and that was the murder. Alternatively, maybe he was already dead when pushed. The autopsy might show the cause of death wasn't the fall. For example, the yellow flecks could be from the Taurusaurus costume, implying he was killed on the set. Therefore, if Lang's testimony 1 says she pushed him off the roof (causing death), but the autopsy shows death was from another cause (like being hit by the Taurusaurus head or something else on the set), that would contradict. 

Looking at Autopsy Report (5): Surrounded by concrete shards (maybe from the set's broken concrete) and yellow flecks. The Taurusaurus Head (7) is from the trailer's roof. If the head fell and hit him, causing death, then the cause wasn't the fall from the building. Also, the Monster Footprints (6) were dug by Excelsius Winner when he dug up the corpse, implying the body was buried there, not fallen from the sky. So the body was placed there after being buried, not fallen. That would contradict Lang's Testimony 1 and 3, which state that the woman pushed him off the roof, leading to his death. Therefore, the Security Camera Footage (10) and the Monster Footprints (6) could show that the president didn't die from the fall but was buried later. However, the key contradiction would be between Lang's testimony that the woman pushed him off the roof (Testimony 1) and the evidence that the body was found on the set, possibly placed there after being buried (Monster Footprints 6). But how does that directly contradict? Maybe the Security Camera Footage (10) shows the president didn't leave via the elevator, but if he was pushed off, there's no footage of him leaving. But if the body was found on the film set, which is at a different location, then the time of death might not align. Alternatively, the Behind-the-Scenes Photo (9) taken yesterday shows no body or footprints. The Monster Footprints (6) were made when Excelsius dug up the body, meaning the body was already buried there. So the president couldn't have fallen from the building two nights ago and landed there, because the photo taken yesterday shows the area was undisturbed. Therefore, the body was placed there after the photo was taken, which would be after the supposed time of being pushed off the roof. That would mean Lang's Testimony 1 is contradicted by Evidence 9 (Behind-the-Scenes Photo) because the body wasn't there when the photo was taken yesterday, but Lang says it was pushed two nights ago. Wait, the timeline: Two nights ago (Testimony 1) is the time of the push. If the photo was taken yesterday (which is one day ago), then two nights ago would be before the photo. So the body would have been there before the photo, but the photo shows it wasn't. Therefore, if Lang says the president was pushed two nights ago, but the photo taken yesterday (the next day) shows no body, then the body must have been placed there after the photo was taken. Therefore, Lang's Testimony 1 is contradicted by Evidence 9 (the photo). Alternatively, Evidence 9 is from yesterday, and the murder happened later. So the contradiction is between Testimony 1 (body pushed off two nights ago) and Evidence 9 (no body yesterday). Therefore, the body was placed there after the photo, which was taken yesterday. So the president couldn't have been pushed off two nights ago and landed there, because the photo shows no body. Therefore, the evidence (9) contradicts Testimony 1. But the user asked for a pair. Alternatively, Testimony 3 claims that the woman murdered the president, but maybe the evidence shows someone else did. For example, the Taurusaurus Plushie (8) can record sound, maybe indicating someone else was involved. But I'm not sure. Let me check the testimonies again. Testimony 3: "That woman murdered the president!" If the evidence shows that someone else did it, like Excelsius Winner (Evidence 16), then that contradicts. But which evidence directly contradicts? Maybe the Monster Footprints (6) were dug by Excelsius Winner when he dug up the corpse, implying he moved the body. So if the president was already dead and buried, then the murderer was someone else, not the woman. Therefore, Testimony 3's assertion that the woman did it is contradicted by Evidence 6, which implicates Excelsius. But how direct is that? Alternatively, the Security Camera Footage (10) shows that the president didn't leave via the elevator, but if he was pushed off, then he couldn't have left. However, the testimony claims that the woman pushed him off, but if the body wasn't found until later, and the autopsy shows death from another cause, then the contradiction would be there. The key contradiction is between Testimony 1 (pushed off two nights ago) and Evidence 9 (photo taken yesterday showing no body or footprints). So if the body was pushed off two nights ago, it should have been there when the photo was taken yesterday, but the photo shows it wasn't. Therefore, the body was placed there after the photo, meaning the president wasn't pushed off the roof. That would contradict Lang's Testimony 1. So the evidence 9 (Behind-the-Scenes Photo) contradicts Testimony 1. But the user wants only one pair. Let me check the JSON answer format. So the correct pair is {"evidence": 9, "testimony": 1}? Or perhaps another one. Wait, looking at Testimony 2: "At the time, there was no one else on the rooftop aside from those two." But maybe the Bug (18) was planted by someone else, implying someone else was present. But the testimony says there was no one else. If the bug was planted on the rooftop, then someone else must have been there. But the Yatagarasu pin's bug (18) was planted by the person in the red raincoat. If that happened during the meeting on the roof, then someone else was there, contradicting Testimony 2. So Evidence 18 (Bug) contradicts Testimony 2. But how does that fit? Let me think. If Lang's Testimony 2 says there was no one else on the roof when the president and the woman were there, but the Bug in Kay's pin was planted by someone in a red raincoat during that time, then that someone else was present, contradicting Testimony 2. Therefore, Evidence 18 contradicts Testimony 2. But I need to check if the timing matches. The bug was planted when? If the meeting on the rooftop was two nights ago, and the bug was planted then, that would mean someone else was there, which contradicts Testimony 2. So that's a possible contradiction. Alternatively, maybe the Bug was planted earlier. The Forged Letter (1) claims to be from Kay, but the Bug was planted by the red raincoat person. If the meeting on the roof was two nights ago, and the bug was planted then, then Testimony 2's claim that no one else was there is contradicted by Evidence 18. So in that case, the pair would be Evidence 18 and Testimony 2. But I need to see which is more direct. Alternatively, looking at Testimony 1 and Evidence 10: Security Camera Footage shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle arriving on the roof, but no footage of him leaving. If he was pushed off, that would explain no leaving footage, but the testimony says she pushed him two nights ago, and the body was found later. But the contradiction with the photo (Evidence 9) showing no body until after. So Evidence 9 and Testimony 1. Let me confirm. Testimony 1: pushed two nights ago. Photo taken yesterday (which is one day ago, so the day after the push) shows no body. But the body was found on the film set. So if he was pushed two nights ago, the body should have been there when the photo was taken yesterday, but it wasn't. Therefore, the body was placed there after the photo was taken, contradicting Testimony 1. So Evidence 9 contradicts Testimony 1. Thus, the correct answer is {"evidence": 9, "testimony": 1}. Alternatively, Testimony 3 claims the woman murdered him, but if the autopsy shows he was killed by something else, like the Taurusaurus head, then the murderer is someone else. But which evidence shows that? The autopsy report (5) mentions yellow flecks, which could be from the Taurusaurus costume (Evidence 14 is mechanic's gloves with dirt, but maybe not). The Taurusaurus Head (7) fell from the trailer's roof. If that's what killed him, then the cause of death wasn't the fall from the building. So the autopsy might indicate that. But the evidence description for 5 says "Flecks of something yellow stuck to clothes." If that's from the Taurusaurus costume, then maybe he was killed on the set. So if he was pushed off the roof but died from blunt force trauma from the Taurusaurus head, that's possible, but how does that timeline work? Maybe the push didn't kill him, but someone else did. Alternatively, if the president was already dead when pushed, then the murder happened earlier. But I'm not sure. The key contradiction seems to be between Testimony 1 and Evidence 9. Because the photo taken after the supposed time of the murder shows no body, meaning the body was placed there later. So Lang's Testimony 1 is contradicted by Evidence 9. Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 9, "testimony": 1}.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, the task is to find one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony. Let's look through the testimonies provided, which are all from Lang.
